intro: Bridelia cathartica, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and dense, dark green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits containing sticky seeds. Bridelia cathartica is also valued for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions and is often found in coastal and inland forested areas.
